intro: Browallia acutiloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaf browallia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes and potatoes, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces clusters of blue or violet flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardeners seeking vibrant, colorful blooms.
